intro: Drosanthemum obibense, commonly known as the silver bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Drosanthemum obibense is also known for its ability to tolerate drought and salt spray, which contributes to its adaptability in harsh environments.
